AdminPage.IntroCopy:
Music Teachers National Association - BYU-I Chapter

About Us: www.mtna.org
Mtna is an organization geared mostly toward private piano teachers to help them continue to improve their teaching skills and knowledge about the piano. 
In our chapter at BYUI, we hear presentation from the piano professors and other guests on different topics that pertain to our specifc needs as piano students, and prospective piano teachers.  Please contact one of the society leadership for more information.

President: Lydia Speth
President Info: spe12016@byui.edu
Vice President: McKenna Rammel
Secretary: Annalisa Wilde

Advisor: Stephen Allen
Advisor Email: allens@byui.edu

Meeting Information:
Thursdays (every other week) at 5:45pm, Snow Room 270

For events check facebook: www.facebook.com/byui.mtna
Upcoming Activities: Feb 24 2014 at 3:15 room SNOW 159 (this is a special meeting)- David Love will be coming to the music265 class to give a presentation on starting a successful studio and his inspiritation to get there.  David Love is successful studio teacher with 60+ students.  He graduated from BYUI with a degree in music and a minor in business.  He uses a lot of technology and innovation in his teaching.  We're really excited to hear from him and get ideas on how to better to prepare to be teachers.

March 6 2014 at 5:45, SNOW ensemble hall, room 183. Brother Allen has arranged for a yoga instructor to come teach us about technique to keep our back, shoulder, arms, neck, etc relaxed and healthy while we practice.  As musicians we often experience a lot of tension due to the position that we have to sit in and the way we use our bodies.  So, we will learn some yoga to help us conteract the tension and feel better.  
**Note: dress down and bring a yoga mat!

last updated February 2014
